values: The whole campus has emptied out, and I like it. There's something so nice about this place being deserted that is so peaceful - and so much like a cheap, crappy scary movie.  I'm almost done with my afghan, and I have all day of doing nothing yet again to finish it.  It's not exactly to my liking, but then again, it's not my blanket.  I intended to finish it yesterday, but I got sucked into Harry and Snape lovliness and wound up rather....distracted.

I'm doing absolutely nothing other than just relaxing and having a good time.  I think that it's probably fairly important to enjoy my last few days here, so I'm taking my time packing, trying to see my friends, and working all the hours I can.  I love it that working involves so much sitting around doing nothing, because that gives me time to read smut and crochet.  This is living the good life....

So this is the first time I've done this whole livejournal thingy, and I feel a bit lost. I doubt anyone will read this, but if someone does and feels like lending a hand to a poor, lost soul, just let me know. I'd appreciate any help I can get. So I'm graduating this weekend. This seems like it should be an astoundingly happy event, but all of a sudden, it's not. I just realized that I have to have insurance, (yes, I know I should have thought about this a long, long time ago) but it wasn't an issue before. Before, I knew what I was going to be doing, and insurance wasn't something that I needed to worry about. Now, all of a sudden I'm thinking about going to grad school, but to stay on my parent's plan, I have to be a full time student. The problem with that is that if I'm a 3/4 time student, it's cheap as hell, but if I'm full time, it's expensive as balls. What to do? Fuck if I know. The main purpose of creating this blasted journal is that I read today on Switchknife's journal about how obnoxious it is for fanfic writers to have "invisible readers." Most of the reason that I don't review the fics I read is because they would be anonymous, and I don't want to do that. So here I am. I'm going to start reviewing. Yay me.
